news.title: Rayner refuses to confirm if two-child benefit cap will be abolished
news.summary: It follows reports that Sir Keir Starmer had informed his cabinet of his intention to abolish the limit.

news.title: Zelensky says 'US silence' over Russian attacks encourages Putin
news.summary: At least 12 people were reported killed in Ukraine, with 13 regions hit by Russian air strikes.

news.title: Renationalised railways not on track for cheaper fares
news.summary: Transport Secretary says she will "strain every sinew" so customers get value for money as SWR brought back into public hands.

news.title: BBC arts broadcaster Alan Yentob dies aged 78
news.summary: He interviewed a raft of important cultural and creative figures over a lengthy career at the BBC.

news.title: Father of nine children killed by Israeli strike still in critical condition
news.summary: Hamdi al-Najjar's "life remains in danger", a Bulgarian doctor working at Nasser hospital in southern Gaza tells the BBC.

news.title: Mother and three children who died in London house fire named
news.summary: The names of a woman and her three children who died following a house fire in north-west London have been released.

news.title: It's the Doctor Who and The Last of Us finales: What's coming up this week
news.summary: K-pop boyband Seventeen also have a new album out, and new game Elden Ring Nightreign is released.

news.title: How one woman's racist tweet sparked a free speech row
news.summary: Lucy Connolly lost her appeal against her race-hate jail sentence, but is free speech under threat?

news.title: Norris wins in Monaco to narrow gap to Piastri
news.summary: McLaren's Lando Norris wins the Monaco Grand Prix for the first time, with Charles Leclerc second and Oscar Piastri third.

news.title: Second suspected sabotage in France as power cut hits Nice
news.summary: Officials say the blaze that caused the power outage is probably of "criminal origin".
